text: Zaid al-Rifai () (27 November 1936 - 12 August 2024) was a Jordanian politician. He was born in Amman, Jordan. He served as Prime Minister of Jordan and formed four different governments, the last of which was Jordan's longest lasting government in the history of the kingdom. It lasted for a term of 4 years and 20 days from (4 April 1985 to 24 April 1989). His father, Sameer al-Rifai, and his son, Samir Rifai, all served as Jordanian prime minister. Zaid al-Rifai was the President of the Senate of Jordan from 1997 to 2009. On 12 December 2009, he resigned from office. ==References== ==Other websites== * Prime Ministry of Jordan website Category:1936 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Prime Ministers of Jordan
title: Zaid al-Rifai
